SEARCH
Package model

Class ControllerLibrary

java.lang.Object
model.ControllerLibrary
public class ControllerLibrary extends Object
The ControllerLibrary class represents the main controller for a library system. It contains methods for adding readers and bibliographic products to their respective ArrayLists, as well as a method for checking whether a given reader ID is already in use. The class also contains methods for converting a date string to a Calendar object, reading simulation sessions, and to many other methods than able all the program requriments that ReadX needs in their library.

  • Method Details

    • addReader

      public String addReader(boolean premiumReader, String nameReader, String idReader)
      This function adds a new reader to a list of readers, either as a premium or regular reader, and returns a message indicating the success or failure of the operation.
      Parameters:
      premiumReader - a boolean value indicating whether the reader being added is a premium reader or not
      nameReader - A String representing the name of the reader being added.
      idReader - A unique identifier for the reader being added.
      Returns:
      A message indicating whether a premium or regular reader has been created and added to a list of readers, or an error message if the ID provided is already in use.

    • checkIdReader

      public boolean checkIdReader(String id)
      The function checks if a given ID is already in use by a reader in a list of readers.
      Parameters:
      id - The parameter "id" is a String representing the ID of a reader that needs to be checked for availability. The method "checkIdReader" checks if the ID is already present in the "readers" list and returns a boolean value indicating whether the ID is free or not.
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether the given ID is already associated with a reader in the list of readers or not. If the ID is already associated with a reader, the method returns false, otherwise it returns true.

      Returns:
      A Calendar object is being returned.

      ParseException

    • addBook

      public String addBook(String nameProduct, int numberPages, Calendar publicationDate, String url, double valueProduct, String review, int gender)
      This function adds a new book to a list of bibliographic products and returns its unique identifier.
      Parameters:
      nameProduct - The name of the book being added.
      numberPages - The number of pages in the book.
      publicationDate - The publication date of the book, represented as a Calendar object.
      url - The URL parameter is a string that represents the web address or location where the book can be found or purchased online. It could be a link to an online bookstore, a publisher's website, or any other website that provides information about the book.
      valueProduct - The value or price of the book.
      review - The parameter "review" is a String that represents the review or description of the book. It could include information about the plot, characters, writing style, or any other relevant details about the book.
      gender - The "gender" parameter in this method is likely referring to the target audience or intended readership of the book. It could be an integer value representing a specific demographic or genre, such as 1 for "children's books" or 2 for "romance novels". However, without more context
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message that confirms the creation of a new book with its corresponding ID code.

    • addMagazine

      public String addMagazine(String nameProduct, int numberPages, Calendar publicationDate, String url, double valueProduct, String periodicity, int category)
      This Java function adds a new magazine to a list of bibliographic products and returns its unique identifier.
      Parameters:
      nameProduct - The name of the magazine being added.
      numberPages - The number of pages in the magazine.
      publicationDate - It is a Calendar object that represents the date of publication of the magazine.
      url - The "url" parameter is a String that represents the URL (Uniform Resource Locator) of the magazine, which is the web address where the magazine can be accessed online.
      valueProduct - The value or price of the magazine.
      periodicity - Periodicity refers to the frequency at which the magazine is published, such as weekly, monthly, quarterly, etc.
      category - The "category" parameter in the "addMagazine" method is an integer value that represents the category of the magazine. The specific categories and their corresponding integer values may be defined by the system or application using this method.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message that confirms the creation of a new magazine with its corresponding product code.

      Returns:
      The method is returning an integer value which represents the position of the bibliographic product in the list of bibliographic products. If the product with the given ID is not found in the list, the method returns -1.

      Returns:

    • consultCodeBibliographicProducts

      public String consultCodeBibliographicProducts(String searchName)
      This function searches for a product name in a list of bibliographic products and returns the corresponding product code if found.
      Parameters:
      searchName - a String variable that represents the name of the product being searched for in the bibliographicProducts list.
      Returns:
      The method `consultCodeBibliographicProducts` returns a `String` message that either contains the matching product names and their corresponding codes or a message indicating that there is no match with the given search name.

      Returns:
      The method `consultObjectProduct` is returning a `BibliographicProduct` object.

    • aggregateBookToReader

      public String aggregateBookToReader(String idReader, String idBook)
      This function adds a book to a reader's list of books and increases the book's sales count.
      Parameters:
      idReader - A string representing the unique identifier of the reader who is borrowing the book.
      idBook - The parameter idBook is a String that represents the unique identifier of a bibliographic product (book) that is being aggregated to a reader's collection.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String variable named "confirmation".

    • aggregateMagazineToReader

      public String aggregateMagazineToReader(String idReader, String idMagazine)
      This function adds a magazine to a reader's collection and increases the sales count of the magazine.
      Parameters:
      idReader - A string representing the ID of the reader who wants to aggregate a magazine to their collection.
      idMagazine - The ID of the magazine that is being added to the reader's collection.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String variable named "confirmation".

      Parameters:

      idMagazine - The ID of the magazine that needs to be cancelled for the reader.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String variable named "confirmation".

    • checkUserHaveAProduct

      public boolean checkUserHaveAProduct(String idReader, String idProduct)
      This function checks if a user has a specific product by consulting the reader and product objects.
      Parameters:
      idReader - This parameter is a String representing the ID of a reader/user.
      idProduct - The id of the product that we want to check if the user has.
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether the user with the given ID has the product with the given ID or not.

    • readingSession

      public String readingSession(String idProduct, String idReader, String simulationOption)
      The function simulates a reading session for a reader with options to move forward or backward in the book and displays ads for certain readers.
      Parameters:
      idProduct - The ID of the bibliographic product being read.
      idReader - A string representing the ID of the reader who is currently reading the book.
      simulationOption - A string that determines whether the user wants to simulate turning to the next page ("S"), simulate turning to the previous page ("A"), or exit the reading session and go back to the library ("B").
      Returns:
      A String message containing information about the reading session, such as the current page being read, the name of the product being read, and options for the reader to navigate through the pages. It may also include advertisements for certain products or services.

    • addNumberPagesRead

      public void addNumberPagesRead(int newPages, BibliographicProduct product)
      This function adds the number of pages read to a bibliographic product.
      Parameters:
      newPages - an integer representing the number of pages that the user has read for a particular bibliographic product.
      product - The parameter "product" is an object of the class "BibliographicProduct". It is being passed as an argument to the method "addNumberPagesRead".
